entry.title: [iOS][LocationBar] Add omnibox switching actions to context menu
entry.content:
Add the actions to move the omnibox to top and bottom toolbar in the

location bar context menu.



When bottom omnibox is enabled:

- The context menu elements now has icons.

- All the copy/paste menu elements are in the same sections.

- Show Top/Bottom address bar action is in a separate section.

- The menu orientation depends on the location bar position.



https://www.figma.com/file/h4dhORq7ozEV5DldotDfFt/Bling-Bottom-Omnibox?node-id=630%3A124468&mode=dev



This CL:

- Adds a custom copy action so it can be grouped with the other paste

actions.

- Adds an image to existing paste actions.

- Adds the new "Show Top/Bottom Address Bar" actions.

entry.title: Enable dawn_use_built_dxc on Dawn Win x64 bots
entry.content:
This CL enables building DXC on Dawn bots and also enables it

by default on dawn_end2end_tests where available.



To maintain coverage of the FXC path, dawn_end2end_tests is run

with --disable-toggles=use_dxc on these bots as well.



The WebGPU CTS is run with --disable-dawn-features=use_dxc to

keep it on the FXC path. A future change will run the CTS using

DXC.



Note: DXC is not built on Windows x86 because the population of

clients on x86 with SM6.0+ (required for DXIL) is tiny, and

currently blocklisted for WebGPU.



Bug: 1462339

Change-Id: I139a8ad9d019d0dda25de8cc631d050560aeb0c5

entry.title: Error close_promise of outgoing stream on error
entry.content:
If an outgoing stream from webtransport is closed,

a close promise is generated and a STOP_SENDING is send.

During the time of closing the stream, e.g. a session close can error

the stream, causing a close promise, that is never settled.

This patch addresses this issue and closes the promise with error.

Symptom of the problem is an outgoing stream close hanging forever.



R=ricea@chromium.org



Bug: 1455664

Change-Id: I9ea5c644095b514bec37383084fa4e389ebcbd3b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4697154

entry.title: DelayBasedBeginFrameSourceMac: Handle VSync parameter skew
entry.content:
The VSync parameters on macOS change over time. In compensation for

this, we re-compute them every 10 seconds (see the initial

implementation in crrev.com/343739).



This function to trigger to update update code wasn't copied

when creating DelayBasedBeginFrameSourceMac, re-introducing the the

VSync skew bug.



Re-add the function (note that all of the supporting variables, like

DelayBasedBeginFrameSourceMac::time_source_next_update_time_ were

correctly copied).



Bug: 1450617

entry.title: Change device ownership retrieval in ChromeUserManager
entry.content:
This change fixes the problems with device ownership retrieval

outlined in go/async-ownership-retrieval.

Currently, the device owner is set everyt time

`RetrieveTrustedDevicePolicies` is called. This results in multiple

calls to `SetOwner` with a an invalid account id (since the owner wasn't

yet final). This change fixes the issue by decoupling setting the owner

and calling `RetrieveTrustedDevicePolicies`.



This CL furthermore renames `GetOwnershipAccountIdAsync` to

`RequestOwnershipAccountId`.



Bug: b/245337406, b/287416180

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter="*ApiGuardDelegateTest*"

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter="*UserManagerTest*"

Change-Id: Ib9a5c799dee0da9e0330e0c2d2b17d0011ab11aa

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4660053

Reviewed-by: Denis Kuznetsov

Reviewed-by: Hidehiko Abe

Commit-Queue: Bastian Kersting

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1172933}

entry.title: [iOS Desktop Promo] Fix QR code race condition
entry.content:
Fix a crash where the QR code generation (with the Rust-based variant

of the QR code generation service experiment enabled) would finish fast

and the passed callback would have no ImageView to attach the QR picture

to - and crash. Changed the order to build the ImageView first before

making the call to the QR code generation service.



Bug: 1465998

entry.title: [ios] Rename WebStateSelection and add new fields/method to it
entry.content:
This CL

- renames WebStateSelection to WebStateListStatus because it has not only `index` that is updated in WebStateList but also the information of an active WebState and a pinned state. `kSelectionOnly` is renamed to `kStatusOnly` accordingly.

- adds `old_active_web_state` and `new_active_web_state` to WebStateListStatus. These will be used when replacing WebStateActivatedAt() with WebStateListDidChange().

- removes `active_state_change` flag and adds `active_web_state_change()` to check if the active WebState is updated based on the information of `old_active_web_state` and `new_active_web_state`.



The third update in the bullet points changes the test expectation in WebStateListTest::MoveActiveWebState. Previously, `active_state_change` could be true when an active WebState was moved. Now, `active_web_state_change()` always return false when an active WebState is moved because the move operation updates the index but not WebState itself.



Bug: 1442546

Change-Id: I18bc810fff46f7e7021ce34870226a0717bd92f8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4687273

Reviewed-by: Federica Germinario

Reviewed-by: Sylvain Defresne

Commit-Queue: Asami Doi

entry.title: mgs: Hide shelf when Chrome App requests fullscreen
entry.content:
This CL removes a Ash Shelf behavior restriction set only for MGS.



When a Chrome app request fullscreen through HTML5 API or app.window API,

the shelf will remain hidden for any user type.



Shelf behavior for Chrome app OS fullscreen (fullscreen requested by

user input) will not change. In this case, the shelf will auto-hide.

entry.title: [iOS] Enhanced and Standard Protection Setting UI Updates
entry.content:
These changes update the UI for enhanced and standard protection safe

browsing setting pages to show more of what enhanced protection has to

offer and remove outdated UI in standard protection.



Additionally, the mediator was removed and the logic was moved to

the enhanced protection view controller because there was no business

or model logic. The mediator was simply providing UI. This was an

incorrect implementation of our initial design pattern which was

seen as okay since we considered data passed to the VC as the model

which a mediator holds.



Afterwards, we realized that we were adding

more overhead by passing a property that was just going to be held

by the view controller anyway. If there was a case where UI items are

manipulated heavily through business logic, it would warrant putting

the objects in a mediator class, but there is no case of that here.



Bug: 1457655

Change-Id: I4ff9660e24a1e901cad728e142478d6ac87df286

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4685459

Reviewed-by: Sylvain Defresne

Commit-Queue: Joemer Ramos

entry.title: [GWP-ASan][LUD] Split slot metadata into two structs
entry.content:
Field experiments have shown that we practically never need more than 24

stack frames in the deallocation stack trace to diagnose a Lightweight

UAF Detector crash report. Additionally, LUD does not collect allocation

stack traces. Therefore, the combined stack trace buffer size used by

GWP-ASan by default is wasteful.



This CL introduces a new slot metadata struct kind with a reduced stack

trace buffer size. It also removes several fields that are specific to

only one of the two kinds.



Bug: 1418006

Change-Id: I48a8631bb981b19b5e5a563c17ad12ad9a7f978e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4701203

Reviewed-by: Matthew Denton

Commit-Queue: Sergei Glazunov

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1172908}

entry.title: [ios][web] Remove the web::BrowsingDataRemover class
entry.content:
The class web::BrowsingDataRemover has the same short name as the

class BrowsingDataRemover from //ios/chrome but is a completely

separate class.



Additionally, web::BrowsingDataRemover is never used directly, only

via web::ClearBrowsingData() function and does not have any state.

Thus it can be removed and the functionality moved directly to the

function itself.



This makes the code easier to understand as there is now only one

class named BrowsingDataRemover, and the functionality needed to

remove data from //ios/web is exposed by a simple function.



Fixed: 1465313

Change-Id: Ie6b586492eddc3720f24a5b45099986aea1f429e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4690262

Commit-Queue: Sylvain Defresne

Reviewed-by: Mike Dougherty

entry.title: Fix selection ring animation
entry.content:
This CL fixes a bug with the selection ring on drag&drop. Video of the

issue:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=13R_ha8k4tzwviePQvkIJGE8uqCk-xc_D



This is due to a workaround that was introduced to make the ring appear

faster after the drop. Video of the "bug" where the ring is slow to

reappear:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=13FDNfUvgQBNnVd6_QRpRbtmWH-Hn6Al-



Thankfully, iOS 16 fixed the drop bug:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=13G_1Kb_TOHtigV34fiZbUvctZQpZORrw



So this CL is removing the previous workaround. On iOS 15, we still have

a slow to appear ring, but it's less important than the initially

mentioned animation issue.



Bug: 1462907

entry.title: Manage SU Interstitial lifecycle on iOS
entry.content:
This change adds lifecycle management to the SU

interstitial. The interstitial instance is wrapped

inside an instance of an `IOSSecurityInterstitialPage`

in order to handle it's lifetime through the existing

logic in IOSBlockingPageTabHelper.



Only the parts relevant to the lifecycle handling are

implemented in `SupervisedUserInterstitialBlockingPage`.



If we decided to do so, we can further refactor the SU

interstitial in the future, to use more existing

functionality from the Security Interstitials classes.

entry.content:
MediaDevices had 3 callbacks.

- EnumerateDevices: rewrote the tests to verify the results of the

promise.

- DeviceChange: rewrote the tests using addEventListener and a

NativeEventListener.

actually closed it. This verification is not needed in these tests. We

can assume that closing a pipe actually closes it. Correct mojo

behavior is tested elsewhere.

there did not stop the test.

entry.title: Do not create PFM from server predictions for renderer-recognized forms.
entry.content:
There are two ways in which PasswordManager learns about forms, creates

PasswordFormManagers for them and (may) attempt to fill:

1) Via PasswordAutofillAgent::SendPasswordForms

2) Via ChromeAutofillClient::PropagateAutofillPredictions



For forms that are received via 2), there is a check whether

a) a PasswordFormManager has already been created for the form

b) a PasswordFormManager will be created for the form once the renderer

calls PasswordManager::OnPasswordFormsSeen() with the form.



Only if neither a) nor b) is true does path 2) create a new

PasswordFormManager. However, over time the check in b) diverged from

the actual code with which the renderer checks whether to notify the

browser.



This CL moves the code for whether PasswordAutofillAgent should notify

the browser about a form to a central helper function and uses that

same helper function to decide whether to skip a form in call path 2).



Bug: 1465803

Change-Id: I8df7625c65fa958773ce501e9ed23cb14a11a807

entry.title: [base][objc] Add API to convert a callback to a block
entry.content:
On iOS (and at a smaller degree macOS) we want to wrap a system API that

is block based in an C++ class that exposes a callback based API (say to

allow using this API from shared C++ code that cannot use Objective-C).



This requires boilerplate code as Objective-C blocks captures by copy

and base::OnceCallback<...> is not copyable, thus it needs to be moved

to a local variable marked with the __block qualifier.



Expose a function base::CallbackToBlock(...) that converts a callback

to a block with the same signature. The function is overloaded to work

with both base::OnceCallback<...> and base::RepeatingCallback<...>.



Bug: none

entry.title: Implement support for resuming sessions in RemoteSupportHostAsh
entry.content:
Note that the current implementation does not actually reconnects

to the same session but instead it starts a new session.

This is because the It2MeNativeMessagingHostAsh must be updated to

actually receive all information required to reconnect to a session

(like the keypair created for the connection).

entry.title: Avoid dangling pointer in PasswordGenerationControllerImpl on Android.
entry.content:
Since there is no guaranteed order in which WebContentsUserData objects

are destroyed, the pointer to ChromePasswordManagerClient may become

temporarily dangling. To remedy this, PasswordGenerationControllerImpl

now cleans itself up on WebContents destruction.



As a unrelated clean-up, we remove a method from ChromeAutofillClient

that informs the controller about RFH destruction. There is no reason

why the controller itself shouldn't be listening to the event

directly.

entry.title: [crypto] TPM metrics collection no longer blocks shutdown
entry.content:
TPM metrics collection can take significant time once a task is

scheduled because it blocks on a system call. This task shouldn't block

Chrome shutdown, so this CL changes its TaskShutdownBehavior from

SKIP_ON_SHUTDOWN to CONTINUE_ON_SHUTDOWN.



This is especially important for tests that might be blocked by an

ongoing TPM metrics collection.



Chrome shutdown handles *already running* tasks having one of these two

options differently:

- Chrome shutdown waits for SKIP_ON_SHUTDOWN tasks to complete

- Chrome shutdown ignores threads that run CONTINUE_ON_SHUTDOWN tasks



Bug: 1464248

Change-Id: I3a24df5c418819aaf43ecd6c6cb47f93a0dd6005

entry.title: Revert "[ProfileSelections] Transition extension keyed factories to use Profile Selections"
entry.content:
This reverts commit f93ee8bbfe4108f5cce0beb322142d5332a864bf.



Reason for revert: causes crashes on Canary, see https://crbug.com/1466101



Original change's description:

> [ProfileSelections] Transition extension keyed factories to use Profile Selections

>

> Make sure that all extension factories (that do not use the

> BrowserContextKeyedAPI) use the Profile Selection logic through the

> ExtensionBrowserClient to have more control over different profile

> types.

> Mainly so that it stops being able to indirectly create services for the

> System Profile and be able to easily control the creation for the Guest

> Profile through the force variable.

>

> Changes:

> - `GetOriginalContext()` --> `GetContextRedirectedToOriginal()`

> - `context` --> `GetContextOwnInstance()`

> - no implementation --> `GetContextForOriginalOnly()`

>

> These changes will indirectly cause those services not to be able to be

> created for the System Profile, and the creation for the Guest Profile

> will be dependant on the `force_guest_profile` variable.

>

> Also added protections to some stacks in extensions to return early in

> case of System Profile (Extensions are disabled in the System Profile).

>

> Bug: 1284664

> Change-Id: I1ca9a345ca769ef42cb17ae38516a399283c4fd2

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4665672

> Reviewed-by: David Roger

> Commit-Queue: Ryan Sultanem

> Reviewed-by: Dominick Ng

> Reviewed-by: Devlin Cronin

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1171652}



Bug: 1284664, 1466101

Change-Id: I4f8b486a0af56172bc2ff90839235bb53ce1c4e6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4701020

Owners-Override: Prudhvikumar Bommana

Bot-Commit: Rubber Stamper

Commit-Queue: David Roger

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1172835}

entry.title: [Autofill] Add a new field is_password_type_by_heuristics.
entry.content:
With this field new heuristics for password input recognition which

include, but are not limited to, recognition of key words such as

password and its related translations and abbreviations in the 'id'

or 'name' of the field are introduced. Context of the field is recognized as password without the field necessarily being of type "password" in the HTML code.



Bug: 1466053

TODO: Add and improve tests, improve heuristics.

entry.title: [Autofill] Make usages of FooTestApi, test_api() consistent
entry.content:
FooBarTestApi classes tend to have a long name, which leads to bulky

code when calling `FooBarTestApi(x).SomeFunction()`. Many tests define

a test_api() helper function and write `test_api(x).SomeFunction()`.



This CL unifies these patterns by adding, for each class

FooBarTestApi, a function `FooBarTestApi test_api(FooBar&)` in

foo_bar_test_api.h.

entry.title: [Autofill] Fix DCHECK in RationalizeCreditCardNumberOffsets()
entry.content:
According to the documentation,

`may_be_group({f, f + 1}) && ... && may_be_group({f, f + N + 1})`

is true only if all fields in the range `{f, f + N}` have the

same `max_length`.



However, the implementation only asserts that all fields *except for one*

field f + J for 0 < J < N have the same `max_length`. That is, in the

example







`may_be_group({0, 1}) && may_be_group({0, 2}) && may_be_group({0, 3})`

is true even though the documentation requires `!may_be_group({0, 3})`.



This CL fixes this issue.



Bug: 1465573

Change-Id: I0fe97187abec3c76e43ff9d58ba89eb721607ccc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4702447

Reviewed-by: Dominic Battre

Commit-Queue: Christoph Schwering

Code-Coverage: Findit

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1172820}

entry.title: Reland "[Office upload] Always use a Copy IO Task when uploading to Drive"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 6129485af6c8259267e7b0e588e1e684b7e02a42



Fixed MSAN issue by checking if observed_delete_task_id_ has been

initialised.



Original change's description:

> [Office upload] Always use a Copy IO Task when uploading to Drive

>

> Previous Upload to Drive flow:

> - Copy/Move IO task.

> - Sync to Drive.

> - Call upload callback.

>

> New Upload to Drive flow:

> - Copy:

> - Copy IO task.

> - Sync to Drive.

> - OnEndCopy:

> - If the upload was successful and was supposed to be a Move:

> - Delete the source file.

> - If the upload was unsuccessful:

> - Delete the destination file.

> - Call upload callback.

>

> Subscribe to Delete IO task updates to ensure the upload doesn't

> complete until the delete has completed.

>

> This change was introduced so a Cancel button can be added to the

> progress notification for a Move to Drive upload. The source file is

> deleted after the Move IO task completes. So now if the user clicks the

> Cancel button during the sync phase, there is no need to awkwardly

> restore back the source file.

>

> Bug: b/244396230

> Change-Id: Ia6f4263e9cd826a3f7ab4a1c694f9d65621e687a

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4680762

> Reviewed-by: Peter Marshall

> Commit-Queue: Cassy Chun-Crogan

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1171602}

entry.content:

written as use_v4l2_codecs.



This has been corrected, and the config and builder names have all been

updated to reflect this.



Original change's description:

> Add trybot coverage for Linux V4L2 decoders

>

> Support for V4L2 decoders on standard Linux was recently added and

> finished. Since this was previously only used by ChromeOS, which had

> relaxed code style checking and other minor differences from the

> standard Chrome builds, and V4L2 codecs aren't enabled by default

> for Linux, ChromeOS work tends to overlook code style requirements

> and other ChromeOS differences that may cause this support to

> degrade again.

>

> Add trybot coverage for Linux V4L2 decoders, so that any bad changes

> can be caught before they land.

>

entry.title: multipaste: Update contents view clip paths
entry.content:
This CL fixes two small mistakes in clipboard history item contents

views' clip paths:



1. The text contents view's clip path should be no shorter than the

view's height. The current path matches the original spec but is not

tall enough given that URL titles (forthcoming) are implemented as

part of the contents view. With a dynamic height for the clip path,

we also need to ensure that the clip path is no shorter than the full

corner cutout's height.

2. The bitmap contents view's clip path currently has an offset that was

erroneously assigned a semantic value (the corner radius, which

changed from 8 to 12 in the spec at the last minute).



Additionally, this CL removes the text contents view constructor's call

to `SetClipPath()`, which is unnecessary because the delete button is

always hidden when a menu item is constructed.



Bug: b/267693870

Change-Id: I17598b61c2a020426c5af7f93f3d952356158408

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4698007

Commit-Queue: Colin Kincaid

Reviewed-by: David Black

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1172793}

entry.title: [siso] Fix remote errors in Android CQ builds
entry.content:

entry.title: Redirect VolumeManager to original profile for incognito
entry.content:
GuestOS filesystems always mount with the original profile, so

they are not currently visible when using incognito FilesApp.



We should always have a single VolumeManager shared between regular

and incognito for all volume types.



This implements change as discussed in http://crbug.com/1383113#c21



Undoes code from http://crrev.com/c/3865352 where GuestOsMountProvider

was updated to support multiple VolumeManagers in incognito.

entry.title: [Exo]SurfaceTreeHost owns the frame_sink and drives surface_id update
entry.content:
SurfaceTreeHost will update the child portion of the surface_id when it

sees the scale_factor or rect of the next compositor frame change, and

immediately synchronize to host_window()->layer() that embeds the

surface draw quad. Skipping the OnSurfaceActivation IPC from Viz to

host_window() to embed a new surface.



host_window()->GetSurfaceId() may update the parent portion of the

surface_id but it shall only be sync'ed to the SurfaceTreeHost's

frame_sink when a configure is acknowledged.



This prevents unexpected resource being held by viz when host_window

properties(bounds/scale) change.



Bug: 1251778

Change-Id: I2eec337337fed7ec77488b535368ed3355a87ee7

entry.title: ozone/wayland: Set clip rect from augmented_surface
entry.content:
This CL lets WaylandFrameManager use augmented_surface_set_clip instead

of augmented_sub_surface_set_clip, which means, we set clip rect on

local surface coordinates instead of parent surface.



This is a client side implementation.

Server side implementation is done in crrev.com/c/4692717.



This is a part of window jitter fix.

entry.title: Exo: Handle clip rect on local surface coordinate on server
entry.content:
This CL introduces augmented_surface_set_clip which uses local surface

coordinates for clip rect to unblock clip delegation.

`clip_rect` was not adjusted to the correct coordinates when host window

origin is not (0, 0). This change allows us to adjust the coordinates

correctly inside surface hierarchy.



We used to use augmented_sub_surface_set_clip where the clip rect is set

on parent surface coordinates, and we still support this protocol for

now.



This CL does not change the behavior yet as the newly introduced

protocol is not yet used by client side.

This is part of window jitter fix.



Bug: 1457446, 1385509

Change-Id: Iaa0f9ae1fa4fd594bfa1f0d4ef9c3a09c338a366
